sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
import { Card, CardContent, Typography } from '@material-ui/core';

export default function aboutMeCard() {

    return (
        <Card>
            <CardContent>
                <Typography color="textSecondary" variant="h4">
                    About Me
                </Typography>
                <Typography variant="body1" component="p">
                    Hi, my name is Ricky and I'm 22 years old. I am a recent graduate from Texas Chrisitian University
                    where I studied mechanical engineering. Undertaking an engineering disciple allowed me to explore my interests
                    in the fields of math and science and develop my technical and analytical thinking skills. Towards the end
                    of my college career, I began to develop a keen interest in computer programming and software development. 
                    Upon graduation, I siezed an opportunity to spend 3 months in Banglore, India working with an oversees software
                    development team. The comapny was in the later stages of start-up development and they needed me to work 
                    with both frontend and backend web frameworks, while in a new, fast-paced and challenging environment. 
                    With no previous familiarity with the frontend and backend frameworks they were using, I was eager to accept 
                    the challenge of learning through struggle and persistence. 
                    
                    After months of programming with the team I am extremely please with the skills and knowledge that I have
                    aquired during my time there. I have learned that it's all about seeing struggle and failure as a catalyst 
                    for growth. It about undertaking challenges for the sole purpose of testing and pushing your limits so that
                    you can become more than you are now. It's about being calm in the face of stress and being increasingly persistent 
                    when things seem to be going against you. The mantra was: Dont give up..take a breathe..come at it from a 
                    different angle, a different point of view. Indeed, many of the lessons I have learned during my months of programming
                    and struggle have practical applications in everyday life. 
                    
                    I am a strong believer that you need to assimilate and implement new ideas, new goals, new teachings, new interests
                    consistenly ad willyfully in order to fully expereince and grasp the depth of it. After my college graduation, 
                    I knew it was time to challenge myself and throw myself into a completely new enviroment to test myself and see
                    just what I'm made of. This compelling desire has been partially satisfied by these last few months in India. I say
                    partially because I am just getting started on my journey of challenges, growth, failure and ultimately success. I
                    am constantly searching for new experinces and environements that will allow my to push myself to reach my fullest
                    potential and 

                    
                </Typography>

            </CardContent>
        </Card>
    )
}
